intro: Thrixspermum austrosinense, commonly known as the southern China thrixspermum, is a rare and lesser-known flowering plant native to southeastern China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within its native habitat, often in mountainous regions. Its botanical features include simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
